720777f-a.text:
Lafayette Street (Elm Street), north from but not including East Houston Street, showing the street under construction after the demolition of buildings which formerly stood there. The construction of the street necessitated the razing of many buildings in a northerly direction from Elm Street, which terminated at a point slightly south of Jersey Street, to Lafayette Place, which commenced at Great Jones Street. The new thoroughfare was named Lafayette Street several years later.
November 5, 1900.
Board of Transportation Photograph.
William B. Parsons Collection.
720777f-a.folder: Lafayette Street & Houston Street (East), Manhattan, NY

720778f-a.text:
Lafayette Street (Elm Street), north from but not including East Houston Street, showing construction work in progress on the Interborough Rapid Transit Co. (I.R.T.) subway, after the demolition of buildings which formerly stood there. Lafayette Street was created by the joining of Elm Street, which terminated at a point slightly south of Sersey Street with Lafayette Place, which commenced at Great Jones Street. This necessitatec the razing of many houses which stood between the above mentioned two thoroughfares. The new street was given its present name several years later.
November 12, 1900.
Board of Transportation Photograph.
william B. Parsons Collection.
720778f-a.folder: Lafayette Street & Houston Street (East), Manhattan, NY

720808f-a.text:
Lafayette Street (Elm Street), north from but not including East Houston, to and including East 8th Streets, showing the street under construction. The building of the street necessitated the razzing of many houses in a northerly direction from Elm Street, which terminated at a point slightly south of Jersey Street to Lafayette Place, which comrenced at Great Jones Street. The new thoroughfare received its present nahwe several years later, under which was constructed the Enterborough Rapid Transit Co.
(I.R.T.) subway.
January 3, 1901.
Board of Transportation Photograph.
Villiam B. Parsons Collection.
720808f-a.folder: Lafayette Street & Houston Street (East), Manhattan, NY

720775f-b.text:
(1)
316, 318-322, and 324-328 (only part of which is shown) Lafayette Street, adjoining and north of the N.W. corner of East Houston Street.
February 21, 1932.
P. L. Sperr.
(2)
A portion of the same, at a later date, showing only Nos. 318-322
and 324-328.
March 16, 1934.
P. L. Sperr.
(3)
The same as No. 1, showing the collapse of the 6-story warehouse No. 316. Also shown left is East Houston Street extending west to
Broadway from Mulberry Street.
June 3, 1933.
P. L. Sperr.

719452f-a.text:
East Houston Street, north side, west from Lafayette Street, to Broadway. These buildings were later demolished to make way for the construction of the Independent System Subway (Eighth Ave. subway).
July 17, 1929.
P. L. Sperr.
719452f-a.folder: Houston Street (East) & Lafayette Street, Manhattan, NY

720776f-b.text:

Lafayette Street, at the N.W. corner of East Houston Street, looking westward across Crosby Street to Broadway, showing the collapse of a 6-story warehouse.
June 3, 1933.

(2)
The same, from an opposite direction. (N.E. corner of East Houston and Crosby Streets).

719453f-a.text:
East Houston Street (running through centre), west from and including Lafayette Street (left), to but not including Broadway (right), as seen from Mulberry Street, across the clearance at its N.W. corner with East Houston Street. The clearances shown on both sides of the street were created by the demolition of buildings to make way for the construction
of the Independent System Subway (Eighth Ave. subway).
March 16, 1934.
P. L. Sperr.
719453f-a.folder: Houston Street (East) & Lafayette Street, Manhattan, NY

719456f-a.text:
38 and 40 East Houston Street, north side, east from Lafayette to Mulberry (extreme right) Streets. TTue elongated structure (No. 38 East Houston Street) also bears Nos. 313-319 on Lafayette Street. These buildings are being demolished to make way for the construction of the Independent
System Subway (Eighth Ave. subway).
September 26, 1929.
P. L. Sperr.
719456f-a.folder: Houston Street (East) & Lafayette Street, Manhattan, NY

719455f-a.text:
Houston Street (East), north side, east from and including Lafayette, to and including Mulberry Street. Also shown is Mulberry Street, at the N.W. corner of Houston Street (East). The view shows building on Houston Street (East), raised in order to continue the construction of the Eighth Ave., Municipal
Subway System.
February 21, 1932.
P. L. Sperr.
719455f-a.folder: Houston Street & Lafayette Street, Manhattan, NY
